subject: Science
title: Mount Vesuvius and Pompeii
description: A short lesson to help you apply Mount Vesuvius and Pompeii.

hook.text: In 79 AD, the people of Pompeii had no word for volcano. They didn't know they lived on one.

buildup.text: Vesuvius erupted with almost no warning, shooting ash 33 km into the sky.

discovery.text: Superheated gas clouds called pyroclastic flows raced down at 700 km/h.

twist.text: The ash preserved the city so perfectly that we can still see bread in ovens.

climax.text: Today, 3 million people live in the shadow of Vesuvius. It will erupt again.

punchline.text: Pompeii forgot its volcano. Three million people are doing it again.

quiz.question: What killed most victims at Pompeii?
